direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Our friend from the Chinese restaurant. Thanks, Fran. We better keep it here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, we better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a present for you. I didn't quite know what to get you -- anyway it's a little awkward for me, shopping -- (he has taken out a money clip, detaches a bill)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. CHEAP BAR - COLUMBUS AVENUE IN THE SIXTIES - EVENING It is six o'clock, and the joint is crowded with customers having one for the road before joining their families for Christmas Eve. There are men with gaily wrapped packages, small trussed-up Christmas trees, a plucked turkey in a plastic bag. Written across the mirror behind the bar, in glittering white letters, is HAPPY HOLIDAYS. Everybody is in high spirits, laughing it up and toasting each other. Everybody except Bud Baxter. He is standing at the bar in his chesterfield and bowler, slightly isolated, brooding over an almost empty martini glass. The bartender comes up, sets down a fresh martini with an olive on a toothpick, takes his payment from a pile of bills and coins lying in front of Bud. Bud fishes out the olive, adds it to half a dozen other impaled olives neatly arranged in fan shape on the counter. He is obviously trying to complete the circle. A short, rotund man dressed as Santa Claus hurries in from the street, and comes up to the bar beside Bud.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BUD'S APARTMENT - EVENING The living room is dark, except for a shaft of light from the kitchen, and the glow of the colored bulbs on a small Christmas tree in front of the phony fireplace. Hunched up in one corner of the couch is Fran, still in her coat and gloves, crying softly. Pacing up and down is Sheldrake. His coat and hat are on a chair, as are several Christmas packages. On the coffee table are an unopened bottle of Scotch, a couple of untouched glasses, and a bowl of melting ice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: so here's a hundred dollars -- go out and buy yourself something. He holds the money out, but she doesn't move. Sheldrake slips the bill into her open bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have some nice alligator bags at Bergdorf's -- Fran gets up slowly and starts peeling off her gloves. Sheldrake looks at her, then glances nervously at his wrist watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fran, it's a quarter to seven -- and I mustn't miss the train -- if we hadn't wasted all that time -- I have to get home and trim the tree -- Fran has started to remove her coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. (shrugs the coat back on) I just thought as long as it was paid for -- SHELDRAKE (an angry step toward her) Don't ever talk like that, Fran! Don't make yourself out to be cheap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hundred dollars? I wouldn't call that cheap. And you must be paying somebody something for the use of the apartment -- SHELDRAKE (grabbing her arms) Stop that, Fran.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly) You'll miss your train, Jeff. Sheldrake hurriedly puts on his hat and coat, gathers up his packages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You run along -- I want to fix my face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (heading for the door) Don't forget to kill the lights. See you Monday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Monday and Thursday -- and Monday again -- and Thursday again -- SHELDRAKE (that stops him in the half-open door) It won't always be like this. (coming back) I love you, Fran. Holding the packages to one side, he tries to kiss her on the mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning her head) Careful -- lipstick. He kisses her on the cheek, hurries out of the apartment, closing the door. Fran stands there for a while, blinking back tears, then takes the long-playing record out of its envelope, crosses to the phonograph. She puts the record on, starts the machine -- the music is JEALOUS LOVER. As it plays, Fran wanders aimlessly around the darkened room, her body wracked by sobs. Finally she regains control of herself, and picking up her handbag, starts through the bedroom toward the bathroom. In the bathroom, Fran switches on the light, puts her bag on the sink, turns on the faucet. Scooping up some water, she washes the smeared mascara away, then turns the faucet off, picks up a towel As she is drying her face, she notices in the pull-away shaving mirror the magnified reflection of a vial of pills on the medicine shelf. Fran reaches out for the vial, turns it slowly around in her hand. The label reads: SECONAL - ONE AT BEDTIME AS NEEDED FOR SLEEP. Fran studies the label for a second, then returns the vial to the shelf. She opens her handbag, takes out a lipstick. As she does so, she sees the hundred dollar bill Sheldrake left in the bag. Her eyes wander back to the vial on the medicine shelf. Then very deliberately she picks up Bud's mouthwash glass, removes the two toothbrushes from it, turns on the faucet, starts filling the glass with water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Santa Claus) Drink up, Pop. It's closing time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's early, Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you know what night this is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, Charlie. I know. I work for the outfit. He polishes off his drink, walks out unsteadily. The bartender approaches the dancers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, knock it off, will you? Go home. Bud and Margie ignore him, continue dancing -- or rather swaying limply cheek-to-cheek. The bartender crosses to the juke box, pulls the plug out. The music stops, but not Bud and Margie -- they continue dancing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: out! He goes to the front of the bar, starts to extinguish the lights. Margie picks up her handbag from the bar, and Bud downs the remains of his drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do we go -- my place or yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (peering at his watch) Might as well go to mine -- everybody else does. He leads her through the dark bar toward the entrance. The bartender holds the door open for them as they go out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor Mickey -- when I think of him all by himself in that jail in Havana -- (opening her handbag)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ONE AT BEDTIME AS NEEDED FOR SLEEP

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. CHEAP BAR - COLUMBUS AVENUE - NIGHT The joint is deserted now except for the Santa Claus, who is leaning against the bar, quite loaded, and Bud and Margie MacDougall, who are dancing to a slow blues coming from the juke box. Bud is still in his overcoat and bowler, and Margie is wearing her fur coat. The bartender is sweeping up the place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. BROWNSTONE HOUSE - NIGHT Bud and Margie come walking down the street. As they reach the house, Bud starts up the steps, but Margie continues along the sidewalk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: want to see his picture?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (from steps) Not particularly. Margie, realizing her mistake, hurries back to join him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's so cute -- five-foot-two -- ninety-nine pounds...like a little chihuahua. They pass through the front door into the vestibule. INT. STAIRCASE - BROWNSTONE HOUSE - NIGHT Bud and Margie are mounting the stairs toward the apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I ask you a personal question?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a girl-friend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She may be a girl -- but she's no friend of mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still stuck on her, huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stuck on her! Obviously, you don't know me very well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know you at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Permit me -- C.C. Baxter -- junior executive, Arthur Murray graduate, lover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Mrs. MacDougall -- Margie to you. Bud has taken the key out of his pocket, opened the door to his apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way, Mrs. MacDougall. He ushers her in. INT. APARTMENT - NIGHT It is exactly the way we left it. There is no sign of Fran, except for the gloves she dropped on the coffee table earlier. Bud switches on the light, shuts the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking around) Say, this is Snugsville.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (helping her out of her coat) Mrs. MacDougall, I think it is only fair to warn you that you are now alone with a notorious sexpot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a gleam) No kidding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask anybody around here. As a matter of fact, when it's time for me to go -- and I may go just like that -- (snaps his fingers)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have promised my body to the Columbia Medical Center.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shuddering deliciously) Gee. Sort of gives you goose-bumps just to think about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, they haven't got me yet, baby. Dig up some ice from the kitchen and let's not waste any time -- preliminary-wise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm with you, lover. She takes the bowl of melted ice Bud has handed her, disappears into the kitchen. As Bud starts to remove his coat, he becomes aware of a scratching noise from the phonograph. He crosses to it, sees that the needle is stuck in the last groove of a long-playing record. Bud lifts the record off, examines it curiously, then puts it aside and substitutes the cha cha record. As the music starts, he dances over to the coat-rack beside the door, hangs up his chesterfield and bowler. He turns back into the room, still dancing, suddenly spots Fran's gloves on the coffee table. He picks up the gloves, looks around for some convenient place to get rid of them. Moving over to the bedroom door, he opens it, tosses the gloves toward the bed inside. He shuts the door, starts to turn away, freezes in a delayed reaction to something he saw inside. He quickly opens the door again, looks. Sprawled across the bed, on top of the bedspread, is Fran. The light from the bathroom falls across her. She is fully dressed, still in her coat, and apparently asleep. Bud steps into the bedroom, closing the door behind him, walks over to Fran.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, Miss Kubelik -- get up. It's past checking-out time, and the hotel management would appreciate it if you would get the hell out of here. (Fran doesn't stir) Look, Miss Kubelik, I used to like you -- I used to like you a lot -- but it's all over between us -- so beat it -- O-U-T -- out! (no reaction; he puts a hand on her shoulder, shakes her) Come on -- wake up! She doesn't respond. But something falls out of her hand, rolls across the bed. Bud picks it up, looks at it -- it is his sleeping-pill vial, now uncapped and empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a hoarse whisper) Oh, my God. For a second he is paralyzed. Then he drops the vial, grabs Fran, lifts her into a sitting position on the bed, shakes her violently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Kubelik! Miss Kubelik! Fran's head droops to one side, like a rag doll's. Bud lets go of her, rushes out. In the living room, the phonograph is still cha cha-ing away. Bud dashes to the phone, picks it up. Then it occurs to him that he doesn't know whom to call and he hangs up. Out of the kitchen comes Margie, with a bowlful of ice cubes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I broke a nail trying to get the ice-tray out. You ought to buy yourself a new refrigerator. Bud, not listening, runs past her to the hall door and out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling after him) I didn't mean right now. INT. SECOND FLOOR LANDING - NIGHT Bud arrives at the door of the Dreyfuss apartment, starts ringing the doorbell and pounding with his fist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Dreyfuss! Hey, Doc! The door opens, and Dr. Dreyfuss stands there sleepily, pulling on his beaten bathrobe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (words tumbling over each other) There's a girl in my place -- she took some sleeping pills -- you better come quick -- I can't wake her up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me get my bag. He disappears from the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry up, Doc. Bud turns and runs back into his apartment. INT. APARTMENT - NIGHT Margie has settled herself comfortably on the couch, and is fixing the drinks. The cha cha music is still going. Bud comes flying in, heads for the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey -- over here, lover. Bud stops in his tracks, suddenly aware of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's all this running around? You're going to wear yourself out. Bud strides over to her purposefully, yanks her up to her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not so rough, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taking the glass out of her hand) Good night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (thrusting the fur coat at her) The party's over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter? Did I do something wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (easing her toward door) It's an emergency -- see you some other time. Dr. Dreyfuss comes hurrying in, carrying his medical bag. He stops, bewildered by the sound of music and the sight of a wide-awake girl in the apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not this one -- (pointing to the bedroom)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in there, Doc. Dr. Dreyfuss proceeds into the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, what's going on here, anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. (propelling her toward the door) Just clear out, will you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing back) My shoes. Bud reaches under the coffee table, where she left her shoes, retrieves them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bitterly) Some lover you are. Some sexpot! Bud shoves the shoes at her, takes a bill out of his wallet, hands it to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here -- find yourself a phone booth and call your husband in Havana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet I will. And when I tell him how you treated me, he'll push your face in. (he shoves her through the open door) You fink! Bud slams the door shut, starts toward the bedroom. Halfway there, he becomes aware that the cha cha record is still on. He detours to the phonograph, switches it off, continues into the bedroom. In the bedroom, the overhead light is on, and Dr. Dreyfuss is working on the unconscious Fran. He has removed her coat, and is shining a flashlight into her eyes, examining her pupils. Bud approaches the bed worriedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She going to be all right, Doc?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many pills were in that bottle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was half-full -- about a dozen or so. You going to have to take her to the hospital? Dr. Dreyfuss ignores him. Out of his medical bag, he takes a stomach tube with a rubber funnel at the end. Then he starts to lift Fran off the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me, will you? Between them, they get Fran into an upright position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Into the bathroom. They half-carry, half-drag Fran's limp form toward the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you going to do, Doc?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get that stuff out of her stomach -- if it isn't too late. You better put some coffee on -- and pray. Bud starts away as Dr. Dreyfuss takes Fran into the bathroom. Bud loses no time getting into the kitchen. He fills an aluminum kettle with water, strikes a match, lights the gas burner, puts the kettle on. Then he takes a jar of instant coffee and a chipped coffee mug out of the cupboard, shakes an excessive portion of coffee into the mug, sticks a spoon in it. He watches the kettle for a moment, mops his brow with a handkerchief, then starts back toward the bedroom. Bud crosses the bedroom to the half-open door of the bathroom, looks in anxiously. From inside come the sounds of a coughing spasm and running water. Bud turns away, undoes his tie and collar, paces the bedroom floor. Something on the night table attracts his attention -- resting against the base of the lamp is a sealed envelope. Bud picks it up -- on it, in Fran's handwriting, is one word, JEFF. He turns the letter over in his hand, trying to decide what to do with it. Dr. Dreyfuss emerges from the bathroom, carrying a pale, still unconscious Fran. Bud quickly conceals the suicide note behind his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring my bag. He lugs Fran into the living room. Bud stashes the letter in his back pocket, picks up the medical bag, follows them. In the living room, Dr. Dreyfuss lowers Fran into a chair. Her chin falls to her chest. Dreyfuss takes the bag from Bud, fishes out a hypodermic syringe, draws 2 c.c.'s from a bottle of picrotoxin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roll up her right sleeve. Bud does so. Dr. Dreyfuss hands the hypodermic to Bud, searches for a spot for the injection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice veins. He swabs the spot with alcohol, takes the hypodermic back from Bud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want to tell me what happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know -- I mean -- I wasn't here -- you see -- we had some words earlier -- nothing serious, really -- what you might call a lovers' quarrel -- DR. DREYFUSS (making off-scene injection) So you went right out and picked yourself up another dame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Baxter, you're a real cutie-pie -- yes, you are. Bud just stands there, taking it. Fran stirs slightly, and from her parched lips comes a low moan. Dr. Dreyfuss grabs her by the hair, lifts her head up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you'd come home half an hour later, you would have had quite a Christmas present. With his free hand, Dr. Dreyfuss slaps Fran viciously across the face. Bud winces. Dreyfuss, still holding Fran by the hair, takes a box of ammonia ampules out of his bag. He crushes one of the ampules in his hand, passes it under her nose. Fran tries to turn her head away. Dreyfuss slaps her again, hard, crushes another ampule, repeats the process. Bud is watching tensely. From the kitchen comes the whistle of the boiling kettle, but Bud pays no attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the coffee. Bud hurries into the kitchen. He turns off the gas, pours the boiling water into the mug with the instant coffee, stirs it. From off, come the sounds of more slapping and some moaning. Bud carries the coffee out. In the living room, Dr. Dreyfuss is working another ammonia ampule under Fran's nose. Her eyes start fluttering. Dreyfuss takes the coffee mug from Bud, forces it between Fran's lips, pours coffee into her mouth. Fran resists instinctively, half the coffee dribbling over her chin and dress, but Dr. Dreyfuss keeps at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get some air in here. Open the windows. Bud complies promptly -- pulls up the shades, opens the windows wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (putting the empty mug down) What's her name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Kubelik -- Fran.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Fran, slowly) Fran, I'm a doctor. I'm here because you took too many sleeping pills. Do you understand what I'm saying? (Fran mutters something) Fran, I'm Dr. Dreyfuss -- I'm here to help you. You took all those sleeping pills -- remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mumbling groggily) Sleeping pills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, Fran. And I'm a doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Dreyfuss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dreyfuss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Bud) Get more coffee. Bud picks up the mug, leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Fran) Tell me again -- what's my name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Dreyfuss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what happened to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I took sleeping pills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know where you are, Fran?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking around blankly) No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you do. Now concentrate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Bud is coming back with the coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing to Bud) Do you know who this is? (Fran tries to focus) Look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Baxter -- nineteenth floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Miss Kubelik.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Bud) Mister -- Miss -- such politeness!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Dr. Dreyfuss, discreetly) Well -- we work in the same building -- and we try to keep it quiet -- FRAN (to Bud, puzzled) What are you doing here? Bud throws Dr. Dreyfuss a look, as if to say that Fran's mind still wasn't functioning properly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Fran) Don't you remember? We were at the office party together -- FRAN Oh, yes -- office party -- Miss Olsen -- BUD That's right. (to Dr. Dreyfuss; improvising rapidly) I told you we had a fight -- that's what it was about -- Miss Olsen -- you know that other girl you saw -- FRAN (still trying to figure out Bud's presence) I don't understand -- BUD It's not important, Fran -- the main thing is that I got here in time -- and you're going to be all right -- (to Dr. Dreyfuss)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: isn't she, Doc?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (closing her eyes) I'm so tired -- DR. DREYFUSS Here -- drink this. He forces her to swallow some coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pushing the mug away) Please -- just let me sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't sleep. (shaking her) Come on, Fran -- open your eyes. (to Bud) Let's get her walking. We've got to keep her awake for the next couple of hours. They lift her from the chair, and each draping one of her arms over his shoulder, they start to walk her up and down the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (urging Fran on) Now walk, Fran. One, two, three, four -- one, two, three, four -- that's the idea -- left, right, left, right -- now we turn -- one, two, three, four -- At first, Fran's feet just drag along the floor between them. But gradually, as Dr. Dreyfuss' voice continues droning hypnotically, she falls into the rhythm of it, repeating the words after him and putting her weight on her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Left, right, left, right -- walk, walk, walk -- one, two, three, four -- turn -- left, right, left, right -- now you got it -- DISSOLVE TO: INT. THE APARTMENT - DAWN Through the bedroom window comes the first faint light of dawn. Fran has been put to bed by an exhausted Dr. Dreyfuss. She is in her slip, and Dreyfuss is just drawing the blanket over her. Her eyes are closed, and she is moaning fitfully. Watching from the doorway is Bud, in shirtsleeves now, weary and disheveled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll sleep on and off for the next twenty-four hours. Of course, she'll have a dandy hangover when she wakes up -- BUD Just as long as she's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (massaging his calves) These cases are harder on the doctor than on the patient. I ought to charge you by the mile. They have now moved out into the living room, where the overhead light and the Christmas tree bulbs are still on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any of that coffee left?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. He goes into the kitchen. Dr. Dreyfuss takes a small notebook with a fountain pen clipped to it out of his bag, sinks down on the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you spell her last name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (from kitchen) Kubelik -- with two k's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's her address? (no answer from Bud) Where does she live? Bud appears from the kitchen, stirring the coffee powder in a cup of hot water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (apprehensive) Why do you want to know, Doc? You don't have to report this, do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's regulations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (setting the coffee down) She didn't mean it, Doc -- it was an accident -- she had a little too much to drink and -- she didn't know what she was doing -- there was no suicide note or anything -- believe me, Doc, I'm not thinking about myself -- DR. DREYFUSS (sipping the hot coffee) Aren't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just that she's got a family -- and there's the people in the office -- look, Doc, can't you forget you're a doctor -- let's just say you're here as a neighbor -- DR. DREYFUSS (a long look at Bud) Well, as a doctor, I guess I can't prove it wasn't an accident. (closes notebook) But as your neighbor, I'd like to kick your keester clear around the block. (indicating coffee) Mind if I cool this off? He uncaps the bottle of Scotch, pours a large slug into his coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taking a big gulp of the spiked coffee) I don't know what you did to that girl in there -- and don't tell me -- but it was bound to happen, the way you carry on. Live now, pay later. Diner's Club! (another swig) Why don't you grow up, Baxter? Be a mensch! You know what that means?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mansch -- a human being! So you got off easy this time -- so you were lucky -- BUD Yeah, wasn't I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (finishing coffee) But you're not out of the woods yet, Baxter -- because most of them try it again! (picks up bag, starts toward door) You know where I am if you need me. He walks out, closing the door after him. Bud dejectedly turns off the overhead light, kicks out the plug of the Christmas tree lights, trudges into the bedroom. Fran is fast asleep. Bud picks up her dress, gets a hanger, drapes the dress over it, hangs it from the door. An early morning chill has invaded the room, and Bud switches an the electric blanket to keep Fran warm. Then he slumps into a chair beside the bed, looks at Fran compassionately. The light on the dial of the electric blanket glows in the grayish room. Bud just sits there, watching Fran.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Baxter. Open up already! Finally the door opens a crack, and Bud peers out. He looks like a man who has slept in his clothes -- rumpled, bleary- eyed, unshaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh -- Mrs. Lieberman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So who did you think it was -- Kris Kringle? What was going on here last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All that marching -- tramp, tramp, tramp -- you were having army maneuvers maybe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Mrs. Lieberman -- and I'll never invite those people again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you get from renting to bachelors. All night I didn't sleep ten minutes -- and I'm sure you woke up Dr. Dreyfuss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about Dr. Dreyfuss -- I happen to know he was out on a case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm warning you, Mr. Baxter -- this is a respectable house, not a honky-tonky. (to the dog) Come on, Oscar. Bud watches her start down the stairs with the dog, withdraws into the apartment. INT. THE APARTMENT - DAY Bud closes the door, crosses toward the bedroom, looks inside. Fran is asleep under the electric blanket, breathing evenly. He tries to shut the bedroom door, but it won't close completely because Fran's dress, on a hanger. is hooked over the top. He goes to the phone, picks it up, dials the operator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (his voice low) Operator, I want White Plains, New York -- Mr. J. D. Sheldrake -- (an added thought)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : FADE IN: INT. STAIRCASE - BROWNSTONE HOUSE - DAY Mrs. Lieberman, followed by her dog, is climbing the stairs to Bud's apartment, puffing asthmatically. She seems quite angry as she arrives at the door and rings the bell. There is no answer. She starts knocking impatiently.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: make it person to person. INT. LIVING ROOM - SHELDRAKE HOUSE - DAY The decor is split-level Early American. There is a huge Christmas tree and a jumble of presents, open gift boxes, and discarded wrappings. Sheldrake and his two sons, TOMMY and JEFF JR., are squatting on the floor, testing a Cape Canaveral set the kids got for Christmas. Sheldrake is in a brand new dressing gown, with a manufacturer's tag still dangling from it, and the boys are in pajamas and astronaut's helmets. As for the Cape Canaveral set, it is a miniature layout of block-houses, launching pads, and assorted space-missiles. Tommy has his finger on the button controlling one of the rockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (counting down)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: let her rip! Tommy presses the button, and a spring sends the rocket toward the ceiling. Just then, the phone in the entrance hall starts ringing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get it. He hurries to the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Dad -- why don't we put a fly in the nose cone and see if we can bring it back alive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should send up two flies -- and see if they'll propagate in orbit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See if they'll what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Propagate -- you know, multiply -- baby flies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh -- oh!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (coming back from the phone) It's for you, Dad. A Mr. Baxter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (getting up) Baxter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Person to person. Sheldrake heads quickly for the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Jeff Jr.) Come on -- help me round up some flies. In the entrance hall, Sheldrake picks up the phone, turns his back toward the living room, speaks in a low voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? -- yes -- what's on your mind, Baxter? BUD - ON PHONE BUD I hate to disturb you, but something came up -- it's rather important -- and I think it would be a good idea if you could see me -- at the apartment -- as soon as possible. SHELDRAKE - ON PHONE SHELDRAKE You're not making sense, Baxter. What's this all about? BUD - ON PHONE BUD I didn't want to tell you over the phone but that certain party -- you know who I mean -- I found her here last night -- she had taken an overdose of sleeping pills. SHELDRAKE - ON PHONE SHELDRAKE What? From the stairway beyond him comes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it, Jeff? Who's on the phone? Sheldrake turns from the phone. Halfway down the stairs is Mrs. Sheldrake, in a quilted house-robe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a nice recovery) One of our employees had an accident -- I don't know why they bother me with these things on Christmas Day. (into phone) Yes, Baxter -- just how serious is it? Out of the corner of his eye, he watches Mrs. Sheldrake come down the stairs, pass behind him on the way to the living room. BUD - ON PHONE BUD Well, it was touch and go there for a while -- but she's sleeping it off now. He glances through the half-open door toward the sleeping Fran.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought maybe you'd like to be here when she wakes up. SHELDRAKE - ON PHONE SHELDRAKE That's impossible. (an apprehensive look toward the living room) You'll have to handle this situation yourself -- as a matter of fact, I'm counting on you -- INT. THE APARTMENT - DAY BUD (into phone) Yes, sir -- I understand. (taking Fran's letter out of his pocket) She left a note -- you want me to open it and read it to you? (a beat) Well, it was just a suggestion -- no, you don't have to worry about that, Mr. Sheldrake -- I kept your name out of it so there'll be no trouble, police-wise or newspaper- wise -- As Bud continues talking on the phone, Fran, in the bedroom, opens her eyes, looks around vaguely, trying to figure out where she is. She sits up in bed, winces, holds her head in her hands -- she has a fierce hangover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you see, the doctor, he's a friend of mine -- we were very lucky in that respect -- actually, he thinks she's my girl -- no, he just jumped to the conclusion -- around here, I'm known as quite a ladies' man -- In the bedroom Fran, becoming aware of Bud's voice, crawls out of bed and holding on to the furniture, moves unsteadily toward the living room door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of course, we're not out of the woods yet -- sometimes they try it again -- yes sir, I'll do my best -- it looks like it'll be a couple of days before she's fully recovered, and I may have a little problem with the landlady -- Behind him, Fran appears in the bedroom doorway, barefooted and in her slip. She leans groggily against the door post, trying to focus on Bud and to concentrate on what he's saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: all right, Mr. Sheldrake, I'll keep her in my apartment as long as I can -- any sort of message you want me to give her? -- well, I'll think of something -- goodbye, Mr. Sheldrake. He hangs up the phone slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (weakly) I'm sorry. Bud turns around, sees her standing there on rubbery legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Mr. Baxter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Kubelik -- (hurries toward her)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you shouldn't be out of bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know -- I had no idea this was your apartment -- BUD (putting his arm around her) Let me help you. He leads her back into the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so ashamed. Why didn't you just let me die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of talk is that? (he lowers her onto the bed) So you got a little over- emotional -- but you're fine now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a groan) My head -- it feels like a big wad of chewing gum. What time is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two o'clock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (struggling to her feet) Where's my dress? I have to go home. Her knees buckle. Bud catches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in no condition to go anywhere -- except back to bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want me here -- BUD Sure I do. It's always nice to have company for Christmas. He tries to put her back to bed. Fran resists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Kubelik, I'm stronger than you are -- FRAN I just want to go brush my teeth -- BUD Oh -- of course. I think there's a new toothbrush somewhere. He crosses to the bathroom, takes a plaid robe off the hook on the back of the door, hands it to Fran.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here -- put this on. In the bathroom, he finds an unused toothbrush in a plastic container. His eyes fall on his safety razor. With a glance toward the bedroom, he unscrews the razor, removes the blade, drops it in his shirt pocket. Then he empties the blades from the dispenser, puts those in his pocket. Now he notices a bottle of iodine on the medicine shelf, stashes that in another pocket, just as Fran appears in the doorway wearing the robe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (handing her the toothbrush) Here. How about some breakfast?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- I don't want anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll fix you some coffee. He crosses the bedroom, heading for the kitchen, stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh -- we're all out of coffee -- you had quite a lot of it last night -- He thinks for a moment, hurries toward the hall door. INT. SECOND FLOOR LANDING - DAY Bud comes out of his apartment, leaving the door half open, heads for the Dreyfuss apartment. He rings the bell, peers down over the banister to make sure Mrs. Lieberman isn't snooping around. Mrs. Dreyfuss opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Dreyfuss, can I borrow some coffee -- and maybe an orange and a couple of eggs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (contemptuously) Eggs he asks me for. Oranges. What you need is a good horse-whipping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From me the doctor has no secrets. Poor girl -- how could you do a thing like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't really do anything -- honest -- I mean, you take a girl out a couple of times a week -- just for laughs -- and right away she thinks you're serious -- marriage-wise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big shot! For you, I wouldn't lift a finger -- but for her, I'll fix a little something to eat. She slams the door in his face, Bud starts back to his apartment. INT. THE APARTMENT - DAY Fran enters shakily from the bedroom, looks around for the phone, locates it, picks it up. As she starts dialing, Bud comes in from the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you calling, Miss Kubelik?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My sister -- she'll want to know what happened to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (alarmed) Wait a minute -- let's talk this over first. (hurries up to her, takes the receiver away) Just what are you going to tell her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I haven't figured it out, exactly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better figure it out -- exactly. Suppose she asks you why you didn't come home last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell her I spent the night with a friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone from the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And where are you now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In his apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His apartment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean -- her apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your friend's name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baxter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's her first name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss. (she is impressed with her own cleverness)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When are you coming home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As soon as I can walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something wrong with your legs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- it's my stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your stomach?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They had to pump it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hanging up the phone) Miss Kubelik, I don't think you ought to call anybody -- not till that chewing gum is out of your head. (leads her into bedroom)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they'll be worried about me -- my brother-in-law may be calling the police -- BUD That's why we have to be careful -- we don't want to involve anybody -- after all, Mr. Sheldrake is a married man -- FRAN Thanks for reminding me. She pulls away from him, starts to get into bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (contritely) I didn't mean it that way -- I was just talking to him on the phone -- he's very concerned about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't give a damn about me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you're wrong. He told me -- FRAN He's a liar. But that's not the worst part of it -- the worst part is -- I still love him. The doorbell rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must be Mrs. Dreyfuss -- (starts into living room)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: remember the doctor -- from last night -- that's his wife. He opens the hall door. Mrs. Dreyfuss brushes past him with a tray full of food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So where is the victim? (Bud indicates the bedroom) Max the Knife! She sweeps into the bedroom, Bud tagging along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Fran) Nu, little lady, how are we feeling today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know -- kind of dizzy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. The best thing for dizzy is a little noodle soup with chicken -- white meat -- and a glass tea. She sets the tray down on Fran's lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. I'm really not hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead! Eat! Enjoy! She hands her the soup spoon, turns to Bud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wouldn't have such a thing as a napkin, would you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I have some paper towels -- MRS. DREYFUSS Beatnik! Go to my kitchen -- third drawer, under the good silver, there is napkins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mrs. Dreyfuss. He starts out with a worried backward glance toward the two. Fran is just sitting there, the spoon in her hand, not touching the soup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what are you waiting for -- a singing commercial?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't eat. Mrs. Dreyfuss takes the spoon from her, starts to feed her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must eat -- and you must get healthy -- and you must forget him. Such a fine boy he seemed when he first moved in here -- clean and cut -- a regular Ivy Leaguer. Turns out he is King Farouk. Mit the drinking -- mit the cha cha -- mit the no napkins. A girl like you, for the rest of your life you want to cry in your noodle soup? Who needs it! You listen to me, you find yourself a nice, substantial man -- a widower maybe -- and settle down -- instead of nashing all those sleeping pills -- for what, for whom? -- for some Good Time Charlie? (sees Bud approaching with napkin) Sssh!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gaily) One napkin, coming up. (hands it to Fran) I wish we had some champagne to wrap it around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Fran) What did I tell you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (uncomfortable) Look, Mrs. Dreyfuss, you don't have to wait around. I'll wash the dishes and -- MRS. DREYFUSS You wash 'em, you break 'em. I'll come back for them later. (to Fran) If he makes trouble, give me a yell. She exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She doesn't seem to like you very much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I don't mind. As a matter of fact, I'm sort of flattered -- that anybody should think a girl like you -- would do a thing like this -- over a guy like me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (glancing at night table) Oh. Did you find something here -- an envelope -- ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I've got it. (takes envelope out of back pocket) Don't you think we'd better destroy it? So it won't fall into the wrong hands -- ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open it. Bud tears open the envelope, takes out Sheldrake's hundred dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing here but a hundred dollar bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. Will you see that Mr. Sheldrake gets it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugging) Sure. He puts the money in his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (holding out tray) Here -- take this, will you? Bud relieves her of the tray, sets it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to move the television set in here? (Fran shakes her head) You play gin rummy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not very good at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am. Let me get the cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to entertain me. Bud opens the bureau drawer, takes out a deck of cards, a score pad, and a pencil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing I'd like better -- you know togetherness. Guess what I did last Christmas. Had an early dinner at the automat, then went to the zoo, then I came home and cleaned up after Mr. Eichelberger -- he had a little eggnog party here. I'm way ahead this year. He pulls a chair up to the bed, starts to shuffle the cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three across, spades double, high deals. (they cut) Eight -- ten. (he starts to deal)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pensively) I think I'm going to give it all up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give what up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do people have to love people, anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah -- I know what you mean. (flips over down card) Queen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pick a card. She does, and they start playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you call it when somebody keeps getting smashed up in automobile accidents?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bad insurance risk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nodding) That's me with men. I've been jinxed from the word go -- first time I was ever kissed was in a cemetery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cemetery?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was fifteen -- we used to go there to smoke. His name was George -- he threw me over for a drum majorette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gin. He spreads his hand. Fran lays her cards down, and Bud adds them up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty-six and twenty-five -- that's sixty-one and two boxes. (enters score on pad)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just have this talent for falling in love with the wrong guy in the wrong place at the wrong time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shuffling) How many guys were there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (holding up four fingers) Three. The last one was manager of a finance company, back home in Pittsburgh -- they found a little shortage in his accounts, but he asked me to wait for him -- he'll be out in 1965.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pushing the deck toward her) Cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (she does, and he starts dealing) So I came to New York and moved in with my sister and her husband -- he drives a cab. They sent me to secretarial school, and I applied for a job with Consolidated - but I flunked the typing test -- BUD Too slow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. I can type up a storm, but I can't spell. So they gave me a pair of white gloves and stuck me in an elevator -- that's how I met Jeff -- (her eyes mist up, and she puts her cards down) Oh, God, I'm so fouled up. What am I going to do now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better win a hand -- you're on a blitz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was he really upset when you told him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Sheldrake? Oh, yes. Very.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he does love me -- only he doesn't have the nerve to tell his wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure that's the explanation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really think so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No doubt about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a thoughtful beat, then) Can I have that pad and the pencil?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (handing her score pad and pencil) What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to write a letter to Mrs. Sheldrake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As one woman to another -- I'm sure she'll understand -- BUD Miss Kubelik, I don't think that's such a good idea. He gently takes the pad and pencil away from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, for one thing, you can't spell. And secondly -- if you did something like that -- you'd hate yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (fighting back tears) I don't like myself very much anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pick up your cards and let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I have to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet. I got a terrific hand. Fran, her eyes drooping sleepily, picks up her cards, makes a discard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure you want to throw that card?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gin. He removes the cards from her hand, starts to add them up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifty-two and twenty-five -- that's seventy-seven -- spades is double -- a hundred and fifty-four -- and four boxes -- you're blitzed in two games. He enters the score on the pad. As he starts to shuffle again, he notices that Fran has slid down on the pillow, and that her eyes are closed -- she is asleep. Bud rises, adjusts the blanket over her. He stands there looking at her for a moment, runs his hand over his chin. Realizing he needs a shave, he crosses to the bathroom. In the bathroom, Bud washes his face, squirts some shaving cream into his hand, starts to apply it. EXT. BROWNSTONE HOUSE - DAY A Volkswagen draws up to the curb in front of the house. Kirkeby gets out on the street side, Sylvia squeezes herself out through the other door. Kirkeby raises the front hood of the Volkswagen, reaches into the luggage compartment, takes out a cardboard bucket with a bottle of champagne on ice. Together, he and Sylvia start up the steps of the house, Sylvia already cha cha-ing in anticipation. INT. APARTMENT - DAY In the bathroom, Bud has just finished lathering his face when the doorbell rings. He starts into the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (muttering to himself) All right -- all right, Mrs. Dreyfuss. He glances at the sleeping Fran, picks up the tray, carries it into the living room, pulling the bedroom door closed behind him. But it doesn't shut completely, because of Fran's dress hooked over the top. Bud crosses to the hall door, opens it. Outside are Kirkeby, with the champagne bucket, and Sylvia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Baxter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (blocking the door) What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do I -- ? (to Sylvia) Just a minute. He pushes his way into the apartment past Bud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (closing the door behind him) What's the matter with you, Buddy- boy? I made a reservation for four o'clock, remember? He heads for the coffee table, sets the champagne down. Bud shoots a quick glance toward the bedroom door, gets rid of the tray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, you can't stay here. Just take your champagne and go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baxter, I don't want to pull rank on you -- but I told the lady it was all set -- you want to make a liar out of me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you going to leave, Mr. Kirkeby, or do I have to throw you out? As Bud spins him around, Kirkeby notices the dress on the bedroom door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy-boy, why didn't you say so? (indicating dress) You got yourself a little playmate, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now will you get out? INT. SECOND FLOOR LANDING - DAY Outside the door of Bud's apartment, Sylvia is cha cha-ing impatiently. Up the stairs comes Dr. Dreyfuss, in his overcoat and carrying his medical bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (knocking on the door) Hey, come on, what are we waiting for? Open up, will you? She continues cha-cha-ing. Dr. Dreyfuss has unlocked the door to his apartment, and is watching Sylvia, appalled by the fact that Baxter seems to be at it again. He starts inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling) Mildred --  ! He shuts the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (knocking on Baxter's door) What's holding things up? INT. APARTMENT - DAY Kirkeby looks toward the door in response to Sylvia's knocking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, why don't we have ourselves a party -- the four of us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! He forces Kirkeby toward the hall door. Kirkeby, glancing past him through the partly-open door of the bedroom, catches sight of Fran asleep in bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grinning smugly) Well, I don't blame you. So you hit the jackpot, eh kid -- I mean, Kubelik-wise? (Bud opens the door, gestures him out) Don't worry. I won't say a word to anybody. INT. SECOND FLOOR LANDING - DAY Kirkeby comes backing out the door of Bud's apartment, minus the champagne bucket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay with it, Buddy-boy! (Bud shuts the door on him) Come on, Sylvia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What gives?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little mixup in signals. Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (leading her toward stairs) What's your mother doing this afternoon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's home -- stuffing a turkey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't we send her to a movie -- like Ben-Hur?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's fine. But what are we going to do about grandma and Uncle Herman and Aunt Sophie and my two nieces -- INT. APARTMENT - DAY Bud comes into the bedroom. As he heads for the bathroom, Fran stirs slightly, opens her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just somebody delivering a bottle of champagne. Like some?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking her head) Would you mind opening the window? She turns off the electric blanket as Bud crosses to the window, pushes it up. Then a thought strikes him, and he looks at Fran suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now don't go getting any ideas, Miss Kubelik.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just want some fresh air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's only one story down -- the best you can do is break a leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So they'll shoot me -- like a horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (approaching the bed) Please, Miss Kubelik, you got to promise me you won't do anything foolish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who'd care?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sleepily) Why can't I ever fall in love with somebody nice like you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ruefully) Yeah. Well -- that's the way it crumbles, cookie-wise. Go to sleep. Fran closes her eyes. Bud returns to the bathroom, picks up his razor, starts to shave. But something seems to be wrong with the razor -- and unscrewing it, he realizes that there is no blade. Sheepishly, he takes out the blade he hid in his shirt pocket, inserts it in his razor, screws it shut. Then he resumes shaving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ad lib) Good morning, Mr. Sheldrake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ignoring them) Miss Olsen, will you come into my office, please? He strides into the inner office. Miss Olsen picks up her stenographic pad, follows him in. INT. SHELDRAKE'S OFFICE - DAY Sheldrake is removing his hat and coat as Miss Olsen comes in, shuts the door behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you have a nice Christmas?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lovely. You were a big help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for giving that little pep talk to Miss Kubelik at the office party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dropping her business-like mask) I'm sorry, Jeff. You know I could never hold my liquor -- SHELDRAKE But I thought you could hold your tongue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It won't happen again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet it won't. I'll arrange for you to get a month's severance pay -- (she looks at him, uncomprehending) That's right, Miss Olsen. I'm letting you go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly) You let me go four years ago, Jeff. Only you were cruel enough to make me sit out there and watch the new models pass by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd appreciate it if you'd be out of here as soon as you can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (formal again) Yes, Mr. Sheldrake. She turns and walks out of the office, shutting the door. Sheldrake looks after her for a moment, then goes to his desk, picks up the phone, dials the operator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) This is Mr. Sheldrake. I'd like Mr. Baxter's home telephone number -- that's C.C. Baxter, in Ordinary Premium Accounting -- INT. SHELDRAKE'S ANTEROOM - DAY Miss Olsen has put on her coat, and is going through her desk drawers, cleaning out her personal belongings -- nail polish, emery boards, an extra pair of glasses, etc. As she stows them away in her handbag, one of the buttons on the telephone lights up. Miss Olsen hesitates for a second, then with a quick look around, she pushes the button down, carefully picks up the receiver, listens in. INT. SHELDRAKE'S OFFICE - DAY Sheldrake is dialing the last two digits of a telephone number. After a moment, someone answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Baxter? Jeff Sheldrake. Can you talk? INT. THE APARTMENT - DAY Bud, wearing slacks, a shirt open at the neck, and a cardigan sweater, is at the phone. A pillow and a blanket on the living room couch indicate where he spent the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking off) Yes, she's in the shower -- she's coming along fine, considering. SHELDRAKE - ON PHONE SHELDRAKE Good. Is there anything you need -- money -- ? BUD - ON PHONE BUD No, thank you, Mr. Sheldrake. As a matter of fact, I've got some money for you -- a hundred dollars -- SHELDRAKE - ON PHONE SHELDRAKE Oh. (a beat) Well, if there's anything I can do for you -- BUD - ON PHONE BUD For me? I don't think so. But I was hoping maybe you could do something for her -- SHELDRAKE - ON PHONE SHELDRAKE Like what? Put yourself in my place, Baxter -- how can I help her -- my hands are tied -- INT. APARTMENT - DAY Fran now appears in the bedroom, wearing the plaid robe, and toweling her damp hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) Well, at least you can talk to her -- let me put her on -- and please be gentle -- He puts the receiver down, crosses toward the bedroom door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a call for you -- FRAN (approaching) For me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Sheldrake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to talk to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you should. I have to run down to the grocery anyway -- all that's left around here is one frozen pizza -- (takes raincoat and old hat from hanger) I'll be right back -- okay? Fran nods, watches him go out. Then she glances toward the phone, which is off the hook. Reluctantly she advances toward it, picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) Hello, Jeff. (a long beat) Yes, I'm all right. SHELDRAKE - ON PHONE SHELDRAKE Fran, why did you do it? It's so childish -- and it never solves anything -- I ought to be very angry with you, scaring me like that -- but let's forget the whole thing -- pretend it never happened -- what do you say, Fran? (no answer) Fran -- INT. SHELDRAKE'S ANTEROOM Miss Olsen, glued to the phone, is listening intently. SHELDRAKE - ON PHONE SHELDRAKE Are you there, Fran? FRAN - ON PHONE FRAN Of course I'm not here -- because the whole thing never happened -- I never took those pills -- I never loved you -- we never even met -- isn't that the way you want it? SHELDRAKE - ON PHONE SHELDRAKE There you go again -- you know I didn't mean it that way, Fran. Just get well -- do what the nurse tells you -- I mean Baxter -- and I'll see you as soon as I can. Bye, Fran. (he hangs up) INT. SHELDRAKE'S ANTEROOM - DAY Miss Olsen hangs up the phone, sits there for a moment, weighing what she has overheard. Then she makes a decision, picks up the phone again, dials a number. As she waits for an answer, she glances toward Sheldrake's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) Hello, Mrs. Sheldrake? This is Miss Olsen -- fine, thank you -- Mrs. Sheldrake, I was wondering if we could have lunch together? -- well, I don't know how important it is, but I think you might find it educational -- it concerns your husband -- all right, one o'clock, at Longchamp's, Madison and 59th. She looks up as the door to the inner office opens and Sheldrake comes out. He stops when he sees that Miss Olsen is still there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hanging up phone) Don't worry, I'm on my way. (she rises) I was just making a personal call. She opens her handbag, takes out a coin, puts it down on the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's a dime. She marches out through the glass doors toward the elevators as Sheldrake stands there, watching her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (breathlessly) Oh, Mr. Baxter -- I'm glad you're here -- I was just going to get the passkey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I smelled gas coming from your apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gas? He races up the stairs two at a time, fumbling frantically for his key. Reaching the door of his apartment, he unlocks it, dashes in. INT. THE APARTMENT - DAY Bud comes bursting through the door. The living room is empty, and the bedclothes have been removed from the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling) Miss Kubelik! He dumps the bag of groceries on a table, rushes into the kitchen. The burner has been turned on under the kettle, but there is no flame, and gas is hissing from the vents. Bud snaps it off, starts out again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Kubelik! Meanwhile Fran has appeared from the bathroom, and is approaching the bedroom door. She is still in her robe, and is holding a double sock-stretcher with one of Bud's socks on it. Bud, rounding the corner from the kitchen at full speed, collides with Fran in the bedroom doorway. He grabs her arms with obvious relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. (sniffs) What's that funny smell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gas. (indicating kitchen) Didn't you turn it on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I was boiling some water to get the coffee stains out of my dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (accusingly) You turned it on -- but you didn't light it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you supposed to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In this house, you're supposed to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Bud starts to take off his hat and coat, notices the sock- stretcher in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing with that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was washing my stockings, so I decided I might as well do your socks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's very curious -- I could only find three and a half pair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, things are a little disorganized around here. He carries the bag of groceries into the kitchen, Fran trailing after him. During the following, he removes the contents of the bag -- bread, eggs, bacon, spaghetti, ground round, frankfurters, and assorted canned goods -- sets them out on the drainboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd say. What's a tennis racquet doing in the kitchen? She produces the racquet from behind the stove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tennis racquet? Oh, I remember -- I was cooking myself an Italian dinner. (Fran looks at him oddly) I used it to strain the spaghetti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (thinking it over) Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a matter of fact, I'm a pretty good cook -- but I'm a lousy housekeeper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you are, (indicating the living room) When I was straightening up the couch, you know what I found? Six hairpins, a lipstick, a pair of false eyelashes, and a swizzle stick from the Stork Club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugging) It's just that I'm the kind of guy who can't say no -- I don't mean to girls -- I mean -- FRAN You mean to someone like Mr. Sheldrake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know so. He's a taker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some people take, some people get took -- and they know they're getting took -- and there's nothing they can do about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't say that -- (trying to change the subject) What would you like to have for diner? There's onion soup and canned asparagus -- FRAN I really ought to be getting home. My family will be flipping by now. She starts into the living room. Bud follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't leave yet. The doctor says it takes forty-eight hours to get the stuff out of your system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wistfully) I wonder how long it takes to get someone you're stuck on out of your system? If they'd only invent some kind of a pump for that -- She sits on the arm of a chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know how you feel, Miss Kubelik. You think it's the end of the world -- but it's not, really. I went through exactly the same thing myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, maybe not exactly -- I tried to do it with a gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over a girl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worse than that -- she was the wife of my best friend -- and I was mad for her. But I knew it was hopeless -- so I decided to end it all. I went to a pawnshop and bought a forty-five automatic and drove up to Eden Park -- do you know Cincinnati?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway, I parked the car and loaded the gun -- well, you read in the papers all the time that people shoot themselves, but believe me, it's not that easy -- I mean, how do you do it? -- here, or here, or here -- (with cocked finger, he points to his temple, mouth and chest)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : FADE IN: INT. SHELDRAKE'S ANTEROOM - DAY It is the morning after Christmas, and Miss Olsen and the other girls are just settling down to work. Sheldrake, in hat and coat, approaches from the elevators, comes through the glass doors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. BROWNSTONE HOUSE - DAY Bud comes down the street, carrying a large brown paper bag overflowing with groceries. He goes up the steps of the house and through the front door. INT. STAIRCASE AND SECOND FLOOR LANDING - DAY As Bud starts up the stairs, with the groceries, Mrs. Lieberman comes hurrying down toward him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: you know where I finally shot myself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (indicating kneecap) Here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the knee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh. While I was sitting there, trying to make my mind up, a cop stuck his head in the car, because I was illegally parked -- so I started to hide the gun under the seat and it went off -- pow!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing) That's terrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Took me a year before I could bend my knee -- but I got over the girl in three weeks. She still lives in Cincinnati, has four kids, gained twenty pounds -- she sends me a fruit cake every Christmas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suddenly suspicious) Are you just making that up to make me feel better?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course not. Here's the fruit cake. (shows it to her under Christmas tree) And you want to see my knee? (starts to raise pant-leg)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks. The fellows in the office may get the wrong idea how I found out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So let 'em. Look, I'm going to cook dinner for us. We'll have the fruit cake for dessert. You just sit there and rest. You've done enough for one day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling) Yes, nurse. Bud starts happily into the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for one of the elevator girls -- Miss Kubelik.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So am I. She didn't report this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She didn't. Where can I get some information -- who's in charge here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That comes under General Office Administration. See Mr. Dobisch, twenty-first floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. He steps into an elevator, the doors of which are just closing. INT. DOBISCH'S OFFICE - DAY Dobisch is sitting behind his desk, lighting a cigar. Kirkeby, who has dropped in for a little visit, is perched on the edge of the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: so yesterday afternoon I take Sylvia up to the apartment, and guess who he's got stashed away in the bedroom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kubelik.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No kidding. Buddy-boy and Kubelik having themselves a little toot!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toot? It's more like a lost weekend. Neither of them showed up for work today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What gripes me is the two of them were guzzling my champagne while Sylvia and I wound up at the Guggenheim Museum. The glass door opens and Matuschka comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Dobisch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Karl Matuschka -- my sister-in-law, she runs one of the elevators here -- Fran Kubelik.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (exchanging a glance with Dobisch) Miss Kubelik?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. There may be a lot of employees here -- but we're one big happy family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, she lives with us -- and my wife, she's getting a little nervous -- on account of Fran hasn't been home for two days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (another look at Dobisch) That so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway, we was wondering if somebody in the office would know what happened to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see. (to Kirkeby) What do you think, Al? Can we help the man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after a pregnant pause) Why not? We don't owe Buddy-boy anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. What's Buddy-boy done for us lately?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (scowling) Who is Buddy-boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we dressing for dinner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- just come as you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (watching him) Say, you're pretty good with that racquet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ought to see my backhand. (dumping spaghetti into platter) And wait till I serve the meatballs. (demonstrates)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall I light the candles?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a must -- gracious-living-wise. As Fran starts into the living room, Bud begins to ladle meat sauce onto the spaghetti, humming operatically. In the living room, the small table has been set for two, and prominent on it is the champagne bottle that Mr. Kirkeby left behind, still in its cardboard bucket, but freshly iced. As Fran lights the candles, she notices the napkins on the table, peels a price-tag off the corner of one of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see you bought some napkins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Might as well go all the way. He carries the platter of spaghetti and meat sauce in from the kitchen, sets it on the table, sprinkles some cheese on it. Then he crosses to the coffee table, where a full martini pitcher stands in readiness, fills a couple of glasses. Fran seats herself at the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I used to live like Robinson Crusoe -- shipwrecked among eight million people. Then one day I saw a footprint in the sand -- and there you were -- (hands her martini) It's a wonderful thing -- dinner for two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You usually eat alone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no. Sometimes I have dinner with Ed Sullivan, sometimes with Dinah Shore or Perry Como -- the other night I had dinner with Mae West -- of course, she was much younger then. (toasting) Cheers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheers. They drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what we're going to do after dinner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dishes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, after that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to if you don't want to -- FRAN I don't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to finish that gin game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I want you to keep a clear head. The door bell rings. Carrying his martini glass, Bud crosses to the door, starts to open it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I don't want to take advantage of you -- the way I did yesterday in bed. By now the door is open, and Bud is speaking to Fran over his shoulder. He turns, finds himself face to face with Karl Matuschka, who is standing grimly in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baxter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes? Matuschka shoves him roughly aside, strides past him toward Fran, who has risen to her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's with you, Fran -- did you forget where you live?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Bud) This is my brother-in-law, Karl Matuschka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (friendly) How do you do, Mr. Matuschka?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pushing Bud away; to Fran) Okay, get your clothes on. I got the cab downstairs.
